name: apidoc
description: Host API documentation for applications providing REST APIs, facilitating the design of good resource first APIs.

enums.name: publication
enums.description: A publication represents something that a user can subscribe to. An example would be subscribing to an email alert whenever a new version of an application is created.

values.name: membership_requests.create
values.description: For organizations for which I am an administrator, email me whenever a user applies to join the org.

values.name: memberships.create
values.description: For organizations for which I am a member, email me whenever a user joins the org.

values.name: applications.create
values.description: For organizations for which I am a member, email me whenever an application is created.

values.name: versions.create
values.description: For applications that I watch, email me whenever a version is created.

enums.name: visibility
enums.description: Controls who is able to view this version

values.name: user
values.description: Only the creator can view this application

values.name: organization
values.description: Any member of the organization can view this application

values.name: public
values.description: Anybody, including non logged in users, can view this application

models.name: application
models.description: An application has a name and multiple versions of its API.

fields.name: guid
fields.description: Internal unique identifier for this application.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The unique name for this application.

fields.name: key
fields.description: Used as a unique key in the URL path. Key is automatically derived from the application name.

fields.name: visibility
fields.description: Controls who is able to view this application

fields.name: key
fields.description: Defaults to a key generated from the application name

models.name: code
models.description: Generated source code.

fields.name: source
fields.description: The actual source code.

models.name: domain
models.description: Represents a single domain name (e.g. www.apidoc.me). When a new user registers and confirms their email, we automatically associate that user with a member of the organization associated with their domain. For example, if you confirm your account with an email address of foo@gilt.com, we will automatically create a membership request on your behalf to join the organization with domain gilt.com.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The domain name

models.name: email_verification_confirmation_form
models.description: Data used to confirm an email address. The token is an internal unique identifier used to lookup the specific email address and user account for which we sent an email verification email.

fields.name: code
fields.description: Machine readable code for this specific error message

fields.name: message
fields.description: Description of the error

models.name: generator
models.description: An apidoc generator

fields.name: guid
fields.description: Internal unique identifier for this generator.

fields.name: key
fields.description: A human readable key identifying this generator.

fields.name: uri
fields.description: The uri of the generator

models.name: generator_create_form
models.description: Form to create a new generator

models.name: generator_org_form
models.description: Form to enable or disable a generator for an organization

models.name: generator_update_form
models.description: Form to update a generator

fields.name: visibility
fields.description: Used to change the visibility of the generator. If present on the request, the visibility is set to the specified value.

fields.name: enabled
fields.description: Used to enable or disable the generator for this user. If present on the request, the enabled flag is set to the specified value (true/false).

models.name: membership
models.description: A membership represents a user in a specific role to an organization. Memberships cannot be created directly. Instead you first create a membership request, then that request is either accepted or declined.

fields.name: guid
fields.description: Internal unique identifier for this membership.

fields.name: role
fields.description: The role this user plays for this organization. Typically member or admin.

models.name: membership_request
models.description: A membership request represents a user requesting to join an organization with a specific role (e.g. as a member or an admin). Membership requests can be reviewed by any current admin of the organization who can either accept or decline the request.

fields.name: guid
fields.description: Internal unique identifier for this membership request.

fields.name: role
fields.description: The requested role for membership to this organization. Typically member or admin.

models.name: organization
models.description: An organization is used to group a set of applications together.

fields.name: guid
fields.description: Internal unique identifier for this organization.

fields.name: key
fields.description: Used as a unique key in the URL path. Key is automatically derived from the organization name.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of this organization.

fields.name: namespace
fields.description: Global namespace for this organization.

fields.name: key
fields.description: Defaults to a url friendy version of the name

fields.name: namespace
fields.description: Global namespace for this organization.

fields.name: visibility
fields.description: Public organizations will be listed in apidoc directory. Organizations with visibility organization will only be visible to members of that org.

models.name: password_reset
models.description: Allows a user to change their password with authentication from a token.

fields.name: token
fields.description: Unique one time use token to change a password

models.name: password_reset_request
models.description: Create a password reset request - e.g. an email containing a one time URL to change a password

fields.name: email
fields.description: The email address for which we generate the password reset.

models.name: password_reset_success
models.description: On a successful password reset, return some metadata about the user modified.

models.name: reference
models.description: Represents a reference to another model.

models.name: subscription
models.description: Represents a user that is currently subscribed to a publication

fields.name: guid
fields.description: Internal unique identifier for this subscription record

models.name: token
models.description: A token gives a user access to the API.

fields.name: guid
fields.description: Internal unique identifier for this token.

fields.name: user
fields.description: The user to which this token belongs.

fields.name: token
fields.description: The actual token. Guaranteed to be globally unique.

fields.name: description
fields.description: optional description to help the user manage the token.

fields.name: user_guid
fields.description: The user for which we are creating the token.

models.name: user
models.description: A user is a top level person interacting with the api doc server.

fields.name: guid
fields.description: Internal unique identifier for this user.

models.name: validation
models.description: Used only to validate json files - used as a resource where http status code defines success

fields.name: valid
fields.description: If true, the json schema is valid. If false, there is at least one validation error.

fields.name: errors
fields.description: Contains any validation errors that result from parsing the json document. If empty, the document is valid.

models.name: version
models.description: Represents a unique version of the application.

fields.name: guid
fields.description: Internal unique identifier for this version.

fields.name: version
fields.description: The tag for this version. Can be anything, but if semver style version number is used, we automatically correctly sort by version number to find latest. Otherwise latest version is considered to be the most recently created.

fields.name: service
fields.description: spec/service.json description of this API

fields.name: visibility
fields.description: If provided, updates the visibility for all versions of this application

models.name: watch
models.description: Users can watch individual applications which enables features like receiving an email notification when there is a new version of an application.

fields.name: guid
fields.description: Internal unique identifier for this watch

operations.description: Search all applications. Results are always paginated.

parameters.name: orgKey
parameters.description: The organization key for which to search applications

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of an application. Case in-sensitive. Exact match

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The key of an application. Case in-sensitive. Exact match

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of records to return

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Used to paginate. First page of results is 0.

operations.description: Create an application.
Updates an application.
Deletes a specific application and its associated versions.
Generate code for a specific version of an application.

parameters.name: orgKey
parameters.description: The organization key for which to generate code

parameters.name: applicationKey
parameters.description: The application key for which to generate code

parameters.name: version
parameters.description: The version of this application. Can be 'latest'

parameters.name: generatorKey
parameters.description: The key of the generator to invoke

operations.description: Add a domain to this organization
Remove this domain from this organization
Validate an email address using a token.
List all generators visible by this user

parameters.name: guid
parameters.description: Filter to generator with this uuid

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: Filter to generator with this key

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of records to return

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Used to paginate. First page of results is 0.

operations.description: Deletes a generator.
Search all memberships. Results are always paginated.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of records to return

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Used to paginate. First page of results is 0.

operations.description: Search all membership requests. Results are always paginated.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of records to return

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Used to paginate. First page of results is 0.

operations.description: Create a membership request
Accepts this membership request. User will become a member of the specified organization.
Declines this membership request. User will NOT become a member of the specified organization.
Search all organizations. Results are always paginated.

parameters.name: guid
parameters.description: Finds the organization with this guid, if any

parameters.name: user_guid
parameters.description: If specified, restricts to organizations that this user is specifically a member of (e.g. will exclude public organizations with which the user does not have a direct membership).

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: Find organizations with this key. Case in-sensitive. Exact match

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Find organizations with this name. Case in-sensitive. Exact match

parameters.name: namespace
parameters.description: Find organizations with this namespace. Case in-sensitive. Exact match

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of records to return

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Used to paginate. First page of results is 0.

operations.description: Returns the organization with this key.
Create a new organization.
Update an organization.
Deletes an organization and all of its associated applications.

Change the password for this token. If the token is invalid, has been used, or otherwise no longer can be applied, errors will be returned as 409s. A 204 represents that the user has successfully changed their password.
Create a new password reset. This will send the user an email with a link to reset their password.
Search subscriptions. Always paginated.

parameters.name: guid
parameters.description: Find the subscription with this guid.

parameters.name: organization_key
parameters.description: Find subscriptions for this organization.

parameters.name: user_guid
parameters.description: Find subscriptions for this user.

parameters.name: publication
parameters.description: Find subscriptions for this publication.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of records to return

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Used to paginate. First page of results is 0.

operations.description: Returns information about a specific subscription.
Create a new subscription.
Search for a specific user. You must specify at least 1 parameter - either a guid, email or token - and will receive back either 0 or 1 users.

parameters.name: guid
parameters.description: Find user with this guid. Exact match

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: Find user with this email address. Case in-sensitive. Exact match

parameters.name: token
parameters.description: Find the user with this API token. Exact match

operations.description: Returns information about the user with this guid.

Used to authenticate a user with an email address and password. Successful authentication returns an instance of the user model. Failed authorizations of any kind are returned as a generic error with code user_authorization_failed.
Create a new user.
Updates information about the user with the specified guid.

resources.description: Public resource that can accept JSON input and returns a validation object describing any validation errors.

operations.description: Search all versions of this application. Results are always paginated.

parameters.name: orgKey
parameters.description: The organization key for which to search versions

parameters.name: applicationKey
parameters.description: The application key for which to search versions

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of records to return

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Used to paginate. First page of results is 0.

operations.description: Retrieve a specific version of an application.
Create a new version for an application
Upsert a version of an application
Deletes a specific version.
Search watches. Always paginated.

parameters.name: guid
parameters.description: Find the watch with this guid.

parameters.name: user_guid
parameters.description: Find watches for this user.

parameters.name: organization_key
parameters.description: Find watches for this organization.

parameters.name: application_key
parameters.description: Find watches for this application.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of records to return

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Used to paginate. First page of results is 0.

operations.description: Returns information about a specific watch.
Quick check if a user is watching a specific application.

parameters.name: user_guid
parameters.description: The user for which we are checking. API returns false if the user guid is not provided

operations.description: Create a new watch.
